Key Match Events: The United States won a thrilling super over to seal a famous victory against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup in Dallas.
Both sides finished their innings on 159 in their Group A match at the Grand Prairie Cricket Stadium.
USA made 18 for one in the super over, with Aaron Jones scoring 11 before being run out and seven runs coming via extras.
Iftikhar Ahmed took Pakistan to five for none off two balls in their super over before being brilliantly caught by Nitish Kumar.
USA bowler Saurabh Netravalkar restricted Pakistan to 13 for one in the super over.
Pakistan recovered from 26 for three in the fifth over to reach 159 for seven in their regulation innings.
Pakistan captain Babar Azam hit two sixes in his 43-ball 44.
Shadab Khan struck 40 off 25 deliveries and Shaheen Afridi managed 23 not out off 16.
USA captain Monank Patel scored a 38-ball 50.
A six from Aaron Jones in the final over and a four from Nitish Kumar off the last delivery tied the match and forced the super over.
Post-Match Reflections: USA captain Monank Patel hoped the win would 'open many doors' for the game in the country.
Patel remarked that beating Pakistan in a World Cup is going to help grow cricket in the USA.
